onboarding.invalidOrExpired: The invitation link may be invalid or expired.

accessGroups.title: Access Groups
accessGroups.subtitle: Manage resource permissions for your organization

accessGroups.noModelsAssigned: No models assigned to this group

mcp.configureAndManage: Configure and manage your MCP servers
mcp.accessGroupTooltip: An MCP Access Group is a set of users or teams that have permission to access specific MCP servers. Use access groups to control and organize who can connect to which servers.
mcp.deleteServerConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this MCP Server? This action cannot be undone.
mcp.permissionManagementDesc: Configure access permissions and security settings (Optional)
mcp.allowAllKeysTooltip: When enabled, every API key can access this MCP server.
mcp.allowAllKeysDesc: Enable if this server should be "public" to all keys.
mcp.allKeysCanAccess: All keys can access this MCP server
mcp.availableOnPublicInternetTooltip: When enabled, this MCP server is accessible from external/public IPs (e.g., ChatGPT). When disabled, only callers from internal/private networks can access it.
mcp.availableOnPublicInternetDesc: Enable if this server should be reachable from the public internet.
mcp.mcpAccessGroupsTooltip: Specify access groups for this MCP server. Users must be in at least one of these groups to access the server.
mcp.selectOrCreateGroups: Select existing groups or type to create new ones
mcp.extraHeadersTooltip: Forward custom headers from incoming requests to this MCP server (e.g., Authorization, X-Custom-Header, User-Agent)
mcp.staticHeadersTooltip: Send these key-value headers with every request to this MCP server.
mcp.noCostConfig: No cost configuration set for this server. Tool calls will be charged at $0.00 per tool call.
mcp.defaultCostPerQueryTooltip: Default cost charged for each tool call to this server.
mcp.setDefaultCostDesc: Set a default cost for all tool calls to this server
mcp.toolSpecificCostsTooltip: Override the default cost for specific tools. Leave blank to use the default rate.
mcp.costConfigTooltip: Configure costs for this MCP server's tool calls. Set a default rate and per-tool overrides.
mcp.selectToolsDesc: Select which tools users can call
mcp.selectToolsDescDetail: Only checked tools will be available for users to invoke. Unchecked tools will be blocked from execution.
mcp.connectToServerWithTools: Connect to an MCP server with tools to configure them
mcp.completeFieldsToConfigure: Complete required fields to configure tools
mcp.fillUrlTransportAuthToLoad: Fill in URL, Transport, and Authentication to load available tools
mcp.searchToolsByNameOrDesc: Search tools by name or description...
mcp.noToolsFoundForServer: No tools found for this server
mcp.serverRequiresHeaders: This server requires additional headers. Click "Configure" to provide values.
mcp.selectToolToTestDesc: Choose a tool from the left sidebar to start testing its functionality with custom inputs.
mcp.completeFieldsToTest: Complete required fields to test connection
mcp.fillUrlTransportAuth: Fill in URL, Transport, and Authentication to test MCP server connection
mcp.connectToMcpClientDesc: Use tools directly from any MCP client with LiteLLM MCP. Enable your AI assistant to perform real-world tasks through a simple, secure connection.
mcp.noParamsRequired: No parameters required for this tool.

addModel.title: Add Model
addModel.providerTooltip: E.g. OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, Anthropic, Bedrock, etc.
addModel.modeDescription: LiteLLM endpoint to use when health checking this model
addModel.selectTeamRequired: Please select a team to continue
addModel.selectTeamTooltip: Select the team for which you want to add this model
addModel.teamSelectionRequiredDesc: As a team admin, you need to select your team first before adding models.
addModel.litellmModelNamesTooltip: The model name LiteLLM will send to the LLM API
addModel.pleaseEnterCustomModelName: Please enter a custom model name.
addModel.azureDeploymentHint: Your deployment name will be saved as the public model name, and LiteLLM will use 'azure/deployment-name' internally
addModel.publicNameTooltipDesc: The name you specify in your API calls to LiteLLM Proxy
addModel.publicNameTooltipExample: If you name your public model 'example-name', and choose 'openai/qwen-plus-latest' as the LiteLLM model
addModel.publicNameTooltipUsage: You make an API call to the LiteLLM proxy with model = "example-name"
addModel.modelMappingsTooltip: Map public model names to LiteLLM model names for load balancing
addModel.atLeastOneMappingRequired: At least one model mapping is required
addModel.allMappingsMustHaveNames: All model mappings must have valid public names
addModel.credentialsHint: Either select existing credentials OR enter new provider credentials below
addModel.selectCredentials: Select or search for existing credentials
addModel.teamByokModelTooltip: Only use this model + credential combination for this team. Useful when teams want to onboard their own OpenAI keys.
addModel.enterpriseOnlyFeature: This is an enterprise-only feature. Upgrade to premium to restrict model+credential combinations to a specific team.
addModel.teamOnlyTooltip: Only keys for this team will be able to call this model.
addModel.modelAccessGroupTooltip: Use model access groups to give users access to select models, and add new ones to the group over time.
addModel.modelAccessGroupAutoRouterTooltip: Use model access groups to control who can access this auto router
addModel.selectOrCreateGroups: Select existing groups or type to create new ones
addModel.validPositiveNumber: Please enter a valid positive number
addModel.guardrailsTooltip: Apply safety guardrails to this key to filter content or enforce policies
addModel.guardrailsHelp: Select existing guardrails. Go to 'Guardrails' tab to create new guardrails.
addModel.useInPassThroughTooltip: Allow using these credentials in pass through routes.
addModel.litellmParamsTooltip: Optional litellm params used for making a litellm.completion() call.
addModel.passJsonOfLitellmParams: Pass JSON of litellm supported params
addModel.modelInfoTooltip: Optional model info params. Returned when calling `/model/info` endpoint.
addModel.cacheControlTooltip: Tell litellm where to inject cache control checkpoints. You can specify either by role (to apply to all messages of that role) or by specific message index.
addModel.cacheControlDescription: Providers like Anthropic, Bedrock API require users to specify where to inject cache control checkpoints, litellm can automatically add them for you as a cost saving feature.
addModel.roleTooltip: LiteLLM will mark all messages of this role as cacheable
addModel.indexTooltip: (Optional) If set litellm will mark the message at this index as cacheable
addModel.failedToLoadProviderFields: Failed to load provider credential fields
addModel.gcpServiceAccountHint: Give a gcp service account(.json file)
addModel.azureBaseModelHint: The actual model your azure deployment uses. Used for accurate cost tracking. Select name from
addModel.failedToPrepareModelData: Failed to prepare model data. Please check your form inputs.
addModel.autoRouterDescription: Create an auto router that automatically selects the best model based on request complexity or semantic matching.
addModel.complexityRouterDesc: Automatically routes based on request complexity. No training data needed — just pick 4 models and go.
addModel.semanticRouterDesc: Routes based on semantic similarity to example utterances. Requires embedding model and training examples.
addModel.autoRouterNameTooltip: Unique name for this auto router configuration
addModel.defaultModelTooltip: Fallback model to use when auto routing logic cannot determine the best model
addModel.embeddingModelTooltip: Optional: Embedding model to use for semantic routing decisions
addModel.routesConfigurationTooltip: Configure routing logic to automatically select the best model based on user input patterns
addModel.noRoutesConfigured: No routes configured. Click "Add Route" to get started.
addModel.describeRouteUsage: Describe when this route should be used...
addModel.scoreThresholdTooltip: Minimum similarity score to route to this model (0-1)
addModel.exampleUtterancesTooltip: Training examples for this route. Type an utterance and press Enter to add it.
addModel.utterancesHint: Type an utterance and press Enter to add it. You can also paste multiple lines.
addModel.utterancePlaceholder: Type an utterance and press Enter...
addModel.complexityTierTooltip: Map each complexity tier to a model. Simple queries use cheaper/faster models, complex queries use more capable models.
addModel.complexityRouterExplanation: The complexity router automatically classifies requests by complexity using rule-based scoring (no API calls, <1ms latency). Configure which model handles each tier.
addModel.tierSimpleDesc: Basic questions, greetings, simple factual queries
addModel.tierMediumDesc: Standard queries requiring some reasoning or explanation
addModel.tierMediumExamples: "Explain how REST APIs work", "Debug this error"
addModel.tierComplexDesc: Technical, multi-part requests requiring deep knowledge
addModel.tierComplexExamples: "Design a microservices architecture", "Implement a rate limiter"
addModel.tierReasoningExamples: "Think step by step...", "Analyze the pros and cons..."
addModel.classificationExplanation: The router scores each request across 7 dimensions: token count, code presence, reasoning markers, technical terms, simple indicators, multi-step patterns, and question complexity. The weighted score determines the tier:

login.title: Sign In
login.signInToContinue: Sign in to continue to LiteLLM Dashboard
login.defaultCredentialsDesc: By default, Username is 'admin' and Password is your set LiteLLM Proxy MASTER_KEY.
login.needSetCredentials: Need to set UI credentials or SSO?
login.ssoNotConfigured: Please configure SSO to log in with SSO.
login.ssoEnabledNotice: Single Sign-On (SSO) is enabled. LiteLLM no longer automatically redirects to the SSO login flow upon loading this page. To re-enable auto-redirect-to-SSO, set AUTO_REDIRECT_UI_LOGIN_TO_SSO=true in your environment configuration.

keys.title: API Keys
keys.lastActiveTooltip: This is a new field and is not backfilled. Only new key usage will update this value.
keys.deleteKeyAlert: This action is irreversible and will immediately revoke access for any applications using this key.
keys.deleteKeyConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this Virtual Key?
keys.enterpriseFeatureRequired: This is a LiteLLM Enterprise feature, and requires a valid key to use.
keys.regeneratedKeyWarning: Please replace your old key with the new key generated. For security reasons, you will not be able to view it again through your LiteLLM account. If you lose this secret key, you will need to generate a new one.
keys.gracePeriodTooltip: Keep the old key valid for this duration after rotation. Both keys work during this period for seamless cutover. Empty = immediate revoke.
keys.durationFormatError: Must be a duration like 30s, 30m, 24h, 2d, 1w, or 1mo
keys.gracePeriodRecommendation: Recommended: 24h to 72h for production keys to allow seamless client migration.
keys.policiesTooltip: Apply policies to this key to control guardrails and other settings
keys.accessGroupsTooltip: Assign access groups to this key. Access groups control which models, MCP servers, and agents this key can use
keys.modelsDisabledForKeyType: Models field is disabled for this key type
keys.keyTypeDefaultDesc: Can call AI APIs + Management routes
keys.keyTypeLlmApiDesc: Can call only AI API routes (chat/completions, embeddings, etc.)
keys.keyTypeManagementDesc: Can call only management routes (user/team/key management)

keyInfoView.deleteAlertMessage: This action is irreversible and will immediately revoke access for any applications using this key.
keyInfoView.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this Virtual Key?

regenerateKeyModal.title: Regenerate Virtual Key
regenerateKeyModal.replaceOldKey: Please replace your old key with the new key generated. For security reasons,
regenerateKeyModal.cannotViewAgain: you will not be able to view it again
regenerateKeyModal.throughAccount: through your LiteLLM account. If you lose this secret key, you will need to generate a new one.
regenerateKeyModal.gracePeriodTooltip: Keep the old key valid for this duration after rotation. Both keys work during this period for seamless cutover. Empty = immediate revoke.
regenerateKeyModal.gracePeriodRecommendation: Recommended: 24h to 72h for production keys to allow seamless client migration.

sessionManagement.title: Session Management
sessionManagement.tooltip: Choose between LiteLLM API session management (using previous_response_id) or UI-based session management (using chat history)

additionalSettings.simulateFailureDesc: Causes the first request to fail so the router tries fallbacks (if configured). Use this to verify your fallback setup.
additionalSettings.simulateFailureBehavior: Behavior can differ when keys, teams, or router settings are configured.
additionalSettings.temperatureTooltip: Controls randomness. Lower values make output more deterministic, higher values more creative.
additionalSettings.maxTokensTooltip: Maximum number of tokens to generate in the response.

agentBuilder.complianceNote: Build Agents that pass your compliance requirements.

createKey.searchUsersPlaceholder: Type email to search for users
createKey.selectOwnerTooltip: Select who will own this Virtual Key
createKey.userOwnerTooltip: The user who will own this key and be responsible for its usage
createKey.searchByEmail: Search by email to find users
createKey.keyTypeTooltip: Select the type of key to determine what routes and operations this key can access
createKey.teamTooltip: The team this key belongs to, which determines available models and budget limits
createKey.modelsTooltip: Select which models this key can access. Choose 'All Team Models' to grant access to all models available to the team
createKey.maxBudgetTooltip: Maximum amount in USD this key can spend. When reached, the key will be blocked from making further requests
createKey.budgetResetTooltip: How often the budget should reset. For example, setting 'daily' will reset the budget every 24 hours
createKey.tpmLimitTooltip: Maximum number of tokens this key can process per minute. Helps control usage and costs
createKey.rpmLimitTooltip: Maximum number of API requests this key can make per minute. Helps prevent abuse and manage load
createKey.metadataTooltip: JSON object with additional information about this key. Used for tracking or custom logic
createKey.guardrailsTooltip: Apply safety guardrails to this key to filter content or enforce policies
createKey.policiesTooltip: Apply policies to this key to control guardrails and other settings
createKey.promptTemplatesTooltip: Allow this key to use specific prompt templates
createKey.bypassGuardrailsTooltip: When enabled, this key will bypass any guardrails configured to run on every request (global guardrails)
createKey.tagsTooltip: Tags for tracking spend and/or doing tag-based routing. Used for analytics and filtering
createKey.accessGroupsTooltip: Assign access groups to this key. Access groups control which models, MCP servers, and agents this key can use
createKey.passThroughRoutesTooltip: Allow this key to use specific pass through routes
createKey.vectorStoresTooltip: Select which vector stores this key can access. If none selected, the key will have access to all available vector stores
createKey.agentsTooltip: Select which agents or access groups this key can access
createKey.mcpServersTooltip: Select which MCP servers or access groups this key can access

policies.failedToLoadGuardrails: Failed to load guardrails. Please try again.
policies.failedToConfigureTemplate: Failed to configure template. Please try again.
policies.failedToCreateGuardrails: Failed to create guardrails. Please try again.
policies.guardrailsCreatedSuccess: Created {{count}} guardrail(s)! Complete the policy form to save.
policies.guardrailsCreatedFailed: Failed to create {{count}} guardrail(s): {{names}}. You may need to create them manually.
policies.templateReady: Template ready! Complete the policy form to save.
policies.deleteAttachmentConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this attachment? This action cannot be undone.
policies.deletePolicyConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete policy: {{name}}? This action cannot be undone.
policies.aboutPoliciesDesc: Use policies to group guardrails and control which ones run for specific teams, keys, or models.
policies.whyUsePoliciesItem1: Enable/disable specific guardrails for teams, keys, or models
policies.whyUsePoliciesItem2: Group guardrails into a single policy
policies.whyUsePoliciesItem3: Inherit from existing policies and override what you need
policies.aboutAttachmentsDesc: Policy attachments control where your policies apply. Policies don't do anything until you attach them to specific teams, keys, models, tags, or globally.
policies.scopeKeysDesc: Applies only to specific API keys (supports wildcards like dev-*)
policies.scopeModelsDesc: Applies only when specific models are used
policies.scopeTagsDesc: Matches tags from key/team metadata.tags or tags passed dynamically in the request body. Supports wildcards (prod-*).
policies.enterpriseFeatureDesc: Parts of policy attachments will be on LiteLLM Enterprise in subsequent releases.

info.resolvedGuardrailsDesc: Final guardrails that will be applied (including inheritance):
info.noModelCondition: No model condition (applies to all models)

templates.title: Policy Templates
templates.subtitle: Start with a pre-configured policy template to quickly set up guardrails for your organization.
templates.noTemplatesMatch: No templates match the selected filters.

simulator.title: Policy Simulator
simulator.description: Simulate a request to see which policies and guardrails would apply. Select a team, key, model, or tags below and click "Simulate" to see the results.
simulator.selectTeam: Select or type a team alias
simulator.selectKey: Select or type a key alias
simulator.typeTags: Type a tag and press Enter
simulator.noSimulationDesc: Fill in one or more fields above and click "Simulate" to see which policies and guardrails would apply to that request.
simulator.failedToResolve: Failed to resolve policies. Check the proxy logs.

form.simpleModeDesc: Pick guardrails from a list. All run in parallel.
form.flowBuilderDesc: Define steps, conditions, and error responses.
form.flowBuilderRedirect: You'll be redirected to the full-screen Flow Builder to design your policy logic visually.
form.policyNamePattern: Policy name can only contain letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores
form.inheritTooltip: Inherit guardrails from another policy. The child policy will include all guardrails from the parent.
form.guardrailsAddTooltip: These guardrails will be added to requests matching this policy
form.guardrailsRemoveTooltip: These guardrails will be removed from inherited guardrails
form.resolvedGuardrailsDesc: These are the final guardrails that will be applied (including inheritance):
form.modelScopeDesc: By default, this policy will run on all models. You can optionally restrict it to specific models below.
form.modelTooltip: Select a specific model to apply this policy to. Leave empty to apply to all models.
form.regexTooltip: Enter a regex pattern to match models (e.g., gpt-4.* or bedrock/.*). Leave empty to apply to all models.
form.modelPlaceholder: Leave empty to apply to all models
form.regexPlaceholder: Leave empty to apply to all models (e.g., gpt-4.* or bedrock/claude-.*)

flow.triggerDesc: This flow runs when a request matches this policy
flow.chooseTestSource: Choose a test source above (quick chat or a compliance dataset) and click "Run Test"
flow.productionVersionDesc: Production = the version used when anyone calls this policy by name.
flow.publishDesc: Published versions can be tested in the Playground before promoting to production.
flow.promoteDesc: This version will be used when anyone calls this policy by name.
flow.silentMirroringDesc: Test policy versions on production traffic without blocking requests. Shadow testing helps validate changes before full rollout.
flow.selectGuardrailForAllSteps: Please select a guardrail for all steps

selector.premiumFeature: Setting policies is a premium feature.

impact.globalScope: Global scope — affects all keys and teams
impact.noAffected: No keys or teams currently affected

vectorStores.indexNameTooltip: Name for the vector index (optional, will be auto-generated if not provided). If provided, must be at least 3 characters.

passThrough.title: Pass-Through Endpoints
passThrough.description: Configure pass-through endpoints to route requests to external APIs.
passThrough.deleteEndpointConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this pass-through endpoint? This action cannot be undone.
passThrough.methodsTooltip: HTTP methods supported by this endpoint
passThrough.authenticationTooltip: LiteLLM Virtual Key required to call endpoint
passThrough.whatIsPassThroughDesc: Route requests from your LiteLLM proxy to any external API. Perfect for custom models, image generation APIs, or any service you want to proxy through LiteLLM.
passThrough.routeConfigurationDesc: Configure how requests to your domain will be forwarded to the target API
passThrough.httpMethodsTooltip: Select specific HTTP methods. Leave empty to support all methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH). Useful when the same path needs different targets for different methods.
passThrough.onlyMethodsRouted: Only {{methods}} requests will be routed to this endpoint
passThrough.includeSubpathsDesc: Forward all subpaths to the target API (recommended for REST APIs)
passThrough.headersDesc: Add headers that will be sent with every request to the target API
passThrough.authenticationHeadersTooltip: Authentication and other headers to forward with requests
passThrough.addAuthTokensDesc: Add authentication tokens and other required headers
passThrough.defaultQueryParametersDesc: Add query parameters that will be automatically sent with every request to the target API
passThrough.defaultQueryParamsTooltip: Query parameters that will be added to all requests. Clients can override these by providing their own values.
passThrough.queryParamsSentWith: Parameters are sent with all GET, POST, PUT, PATCH requests
passThrough.queryParamsOverrideExamples: Client parameters override defaults. Examples: version=v1, format=json, key=default
passThrough.billingDesc: Optional cost tracking for this endpoint
passThrough.costPerRequestTooltip: Optional: Track costs for requests to this endpoint
passThrough.costPerRequestDesc: The cost charged for each request through this endpoint
passThrough.failedToUpdateEndpoint: Failed to update pass through endpoint
passThrough.failedToDeleteEndpoint: Failed to delete pass through endpoint

commonComponents.autoRotationDesc: Automatic key rotation settings and status for this key
commonComponents.autoRotationNotEnabled: Auto-rotation is not enabled for this key
commonComponents.expireKeyTooltipCreate: Set when this key should expire. Format: 30s (seconds), 30m (minutes), 30h (hours), 30d (days). Leave empty to never expire.
commonComponents.expireKeyTooltipEdit: Set when this key should expire. Format: 30s (seconds), 30m (minutes), 30h (hours), 30d (days). Use -1 to never expire.
commonComponents.durationPlaceholderCreate: e.g., 30d or leave empty to never expire
commonComponents.enableAutoRotationTooltip: Key will automatically regenerate at the specified interval for enhanced security.
commonComponents.rotationIntervalTooltip: How often the key should be automatically rotated. Choose the interval that best fits your security requirements.
commonComponents.supportedFormats: Supported formats: seconds (s), minutes (m), hours (h), days (d)
commonComponents.rotationNotice: When rotation occurs, you'll receive a notification with the new key. The old key will be deactivated after a brief grace period.
commonComponents.noAliasesYet: No aliases added yet. Add a new alias above.
commonComponents.configExampleDesc: Here's how your current aliases would look in the config:
commonComponents.provideBothAliasAndModel: Please provide both alias name and target model
commonComponents.aliasAlreadyExists: An alias with this name already exists
commonComponents.guardrailsDesc: Configure guardrails to enforce policies on requests and responses. Guardrails are opt-in for passthrough endpoints.
commonComponents.fieldLevelTargetingDesc: Optionally specify which fields to check. If left empty, the entire request/response is sent to the guardrail.
commonComponents.selectGuardrailsTooltip: Choose which guardrails should run on this endpoint. Org/team/key level guardrails will also be included.
commonComponents.tipLeaveEmpty: Tip: Leave empty to check entire payload
commonComponents.specifyRequestFields: Specify which request fields to check
commonComponents.specifyResponseFields: Specify which response fields to check
commonComponents.requestFieldsPlaceholder: Type field name or use + buttons above (e.g., query, documents[*].text)
commonComponents.responseFieldsPlaceholder: Type field name or use + buttons above (e.g., results[*].text)
commonComponents.securityDesc: When enabled, requests to this endpoint will require a valid LiteLLM Virtual Key
commonComponents.authEnterpriseFeature: Setting authentication for pass-through endpoints is a LiteLLM Enterprise feature. Get a trial key
commonComponents.loggingEnterpriseFeature: Setting Key/Team logging settings is a LiteLLM Enterprise feature. Global Logging Settings are available for all free users. Get a trial key
commonComponents.adminRoleDesc: Admin role. Can create team keys, add members, and manage settings.
commonComponents.userRoleDesc: User role. Can view team info, but not manage it.
